jsl.utilities.random.distributions
Class Normal

java.lang.Object
  jsl.utilities.random.AbstractRandom
      jsl.utilities.random.distributions.Distribution
          jsl.utilities.random.distributions.Normal
All Implemented Interfaces:
ControllableIfc, GetValueIfc, IdentityIfc, NewInstanceIfc, CDFIfc, ContinuousDistributionIfc, DistributionFunctionIfc, DistributionIfc, FirstOrderLossFunctionIfc, LossFunctionDistributionIfc, MeanIfc, PDFIfc, SecondOrderLossFunctionIfc, VarianceIfc, ParametersIfc, RandomIfc, RandomStreamIfc, SampleIfc
public class Normal
extends Distribution
implements ContinuousDistributionIfc, LossFunctionDistributionIfc

Models normally distributed random variables

stdNormalCDF

public static final double stdNormalCDF(double z)
Computes the cumulative distribution function for a standard normal distribution from Abramovitz & Stegun, see also Didier H. Besset Object-oriented Implementation of Numerical Methods, Morgan-Kaufmann (2001)

Parameters:
z - the z-ordinate to be evaluated
Returns:
the P(Z<=z) for standard normal

stdNormalPDF

public static final double stdNormalPDF(double z)
Computes the pdf function for a standard normal distribution from Abramovitz & Stegun, see also Didier H. Besset Object-oriented Implementation of Numerical Methods, Morgan-Kaufmann (2001)

Parameters:
z - the z-ordinate to be evaluated
Returns:
the f(z) for standard normal

stdNormalInvCDF

public static final double stdNormalInvCDF(double p)
Computes the inverse cumulative distribution function for a standard normal distribution see, W. J. Cody, Rational Chebyshev approximations for the error function Math. Comp. pp 631-638 this is without the extra refinement and has relative error of 1.15e-9

Parameters:
p - the probability to be evaluated, p must be within [0,1] p = 0.0 returns Double.NEGATIVE_INFINTITY p = 1.0 returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY
Returns:
the "z" value associated with the p
See Also:
http://www.math.uio.no/~jacklam/notes/invnorm/

stdNormalComplementaryCDF

public static final double stdNormalComplementaryCDF(double z)
Computes the complementary cumulative probability for the standard normal distribution function for given value of z

Parameters:
z - The value to be evaluated
Returns:
The probability, 1-P{X<=z}

stdNormalFirstOrderLossFunction

public static final double stdNormalFirstOrderLossFunction(double z)
Computes the first order loss function for the standard normal distribution function for given value of x, G1(z) = E[max(Z-z,0)]

Parameters:
z - The value to be evaluated
Returns:
The loss function value, E[max(Z-z,0)]

stdNormalSecondOrderLossFunction

public static final double stdNormalSecondOrderLossFunction(double z)
Computes the 2nd order loss function for the standard normal distribution function for given value of z, G2(z) = (1/2)E[max(Z-z,0)*max(Z-z-1,0)]

Parameters:
z - The value to be evaluated
Returns:
The loss function value, (1/2)E[max(Z-z,0)*max(Z-z-1,0)]

pdf

public final double pdf(double x)
Description copied from interface: PDFIfc
Returns the f(x) where f represents the probability density function for the distribution. Note this is not a probability.

Specified by:
pdf in interface PDFIfc
Parameters:
x - a double representing the value to be evaluated

invCDF

public final double invCDF(double p)
Provides the inverse cumulative distribution function for the distribution

Specified by:
invCDF in interface CDFIfc
Parameters:
p - The probability to be evaluated for the inverse, p must be [0,1] or an IllegalArgumentException is thrown p = 0.0 returns Double.NEGATIVE_INFINTITY p = 1.0 returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY
Returns:
The inverse cdf evaluated at p
